content.webTitle: It's tough to dislike a $149 personal video player

fields.headline: It's tough to dislike a $149 personal video player
fields.bodyText: "HandHeld Entertainment, the San Francisco company which introduced the portable device late last year, over-promised and under-delivered. There's no user manual, the online customer support site is skeletal and the company's business model looks flawed. Yet the Zvue (www.zvue.com), much to my surprise, actually does a decent job of playing back video on its 2 1/2-inch color LCD screen, and works well as an MP3 music player. At such a low price, that's remarkable," says Mike Langberg at Mercury News.
